Passaic.Vreeland Avenue station: Vreeland Avenue was railroad station in Paterson, New Jersey served by the New York, Susquehanna and Western Railroad (NYS&W). Opened in 1873 by the New Jersey Midland, a predecessor to the NYS&W, it closed in 1966. Other existing original station buildings from the New Jersey Midland can be found at Vreeland Avenue, Wortendyke, Butler, and Newfoundland among other places.
